bill.title: An Act To Amend the Marijuana Legalization Act Regarding Retail Marijuana Testing Facilities
bill.description: An Act To Amend the Marijuana Legalization Act Regarding Retail Marijuana Testing Facilities

history.action: Report READ and ACCEPTED in concurrence
READ ONCE
Under suspension of the Rules, READ A SECOND TIME  PASSED TO BE ENGROSSED in concurrence
Reported by Representative PIERCE for the Joint Select Committee on Marijuana Legalization Implementation pursuant to Joint Order 2017, H.P. 96.
Report was READ and ACCEPTED.
The Bill was READ ONCE.
Under suspension of the rules, the Bill was given its SECOND READING without REFERENCE to the Committee on Bills in the Second Reading.
The Bill was PASSED TO BE ENGROSSED.
Sent for concurrence. ORDERED SENT FORTHWITH.
On motion of Representative GOLDEN of Lewiston, TABLED pending PASSAGE TO BE ENACTED.
Later today assigned.
Unfinished Business
Speaker laid before the House
This being an emergency measure, a two-thirds vote of all the members elected to the House being necessary, a total was taken.
PASSED TO BE ENACTED.
Sent for concurrence. ORDERED SENT FORTHWITH.
On motion by Senator HAMPER of Oxford PLACED ON THE SPECIAL APPROPRIATIONS TABLE pending PASSAGE TO BE ENACTED - Emergency - 2/3 Elected Required, in concurrence.
On Motion by Senator  HAMPER of Oxford taken from the SPECIAL APPROPRIATIONS TABLE.
On motion by Same Senator Under suspension of the Rules The Senate RECONSIDERED  PASSAGE TO BE ENGROSSED
On further motion by Same Senator Senate Amendment "A" (S-326) READ and ADOPTED
PASSED TO BE ENGROSSED AS AMENDED BY Senate Amendment "A" (S-326) In NON-CONCURRENCE
Ordered sent down forthwith for concurrence
The House RECEDED and CONCURRED to PASSAGE TO BE ENGROSSED as Amended by Senate Amendment "A" (S-326).
ORDERED SENT FORTHWITH.
This being an emergency measure, a two-thirds vote of all the members elected to the House was necessary.
PASSED TO BE ENACTED.
ROLL CALL NO. 432 (Yeas 101 - Nays 32 - Absent 17 - Excused 1)
Sent for concurrence. ORDERED SENT FORTHWITH.
PASSED TO BE ENACTED - Emergency - 2/3 Elected Required, in concurrence.

This Bill, having been returned by the Governor, together with objections to the same pursuant to Article IV, Part Third, Section 2 of the Constitution of the State of Maine, after reconsideration, the House proceeded to vote on the question: "Shall this Bill become a law notwithstanding the objections of the Governor?"

ROLL CALL NO. 450V 131 having voted in the affirmative and 6 in the negative, with 13 being absent, and 1 excused, and accordingly it was the vote of the House that the Bill become a law notwithstanding the objections of the Governor, since two-thirds of the members of the House so voted.
Sent for concurrence. ORDERED SENT FORTHWITH.

LD 1641 In Senate, August 2, 2017, this Bill, having been returned by the Governor, together with objections to the same pursuant to the provisions of the Constitution of the State of Maine, after reconsideration, the Senate proceeded to vote on the question: "Shall this Bill become a law notwithstanding the objections of the Governor?" 31 IN FAVOR and 1 AGAINST, accordingly it was the vote of the Senate that the Bill become law and the VETO was OVERRIDDEN.
in concurrence
